title: Turkey bans Instagram without explanation
content: Turkey blocked Instagram without explanation following accusations of censorship by Turkish communications official Fahrettin Altun. Altun claimed Instagram impeded condolence posts for Hamas official Ismail Haniyeh, killed in Tehran. The Turkish Information Technologies and Communication Authority announced the block, affecting over 50 million Turkish Instagram users. Meta Platforms has not commented on the issue.
summary: Turkey blocked Instagram without explanation following accusations of censorship by Turkish communications official Fahrettin Altun. The Turkish Information Technologies and Communication Authority announced the block, affecting over 50 million Turkish Instagram users. Meta Platforms has not commented on the issue.

How Joe Biden persuaded German Chancellor Scholz to release a top Kremlin assassin
content: The release of US journalist Evan Gershkovich and 15 others in a historic prisoner swap was facilitated by a personal promise from German Chancellor Olaf Scholz to Biden during a visit to the White House. The plan, discussed on February 9, involved Biden asking Scholz to release Vadim Krasikov, a convicted Russian murderer serving a life sentence in Germany, as part of a complex arrangement involving six countries.

Biden calls Netanyahu, says US committed to defend Israel's security 'against all threats from Iran'
content: US President Joe Biden reiterated his commitment to Israel's security during a telephone conversation with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, stressing the importance of the country's defense against threats from Iran and its proxies. This conversation followed the killing of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran, which Hamas attributes to Israel.
